removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast expression are redundant. The cast must be written as (double*)A; the extra surrounding parentheses add no precedence or clarity.
Same as above: the outer parentheses around the cast are unnecessary.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast inside the function call; (double*)A is sufficient.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast inside the function call.
Outer parentheses around the cast used as a function argument are unnecessary.
The outermost parentheses surrounding the cast expression passed to free are redundant; keep the cast parentheses but remove the extra surrounding pair.
Same as above for the B pointer: the extra surrounding parentheses are unnecessary.
The outer parentheses wrapping the arithmetic expression are redundant; the inner grouping is retained and the expression remains clear.
The outer parentheses around the sum are not needed. The individual casts must remain, but wrapping the entire sum in an extra pair is redundant.
Inside the array index the outer parentheses are redundant; keeping a single pair for the subexpression is sufficient and clearer.
Same as idx_ijk above: the outer parentheses are redundant.
Remove outer parentheses around the sum; preserve the necessary per-term casts.
Outer parentheses around the array index are redundant; use the simpler expression.

The inner parentheses around (num + factor) are unnecessary. We still need parentheses around the whole numerator to control precedence of division, so replace the nested parentheses with a single pair around the numerator.
Parentheses around this simple subtraction are unnecessary in the relational expression i < iter - 1 because the subtraction will be evaluated before the comparison due to operator precedence.
Same as above for j < iter - 1; the parentheses add no functional or readability benefit here.
Same as above for k < iter - 1.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses used in the left-hand array index; keeping the inner grouping is enough.
One level of parentheses around the index expression is redundant; reduce to a single grouping while preserving the (i + 1) subexpression.
Parentheses around the multiplication are unnecessary: multiplication binds tighter than subtraction, and the array index's redundant outer parentheses can be simplified.
Reduce nested grouping to a single necessary grouping while preserving (i - 1).
Remove one level of redundant parentheses; keep the (j + 1) grouping for clarity.
Same as above for (j - 1): reduce redundant outer parentheses while preserving the inner grouping.
The outer parentheses around adding 1 are unnecessary; keep the index grouping itself but remove the extra outer pair.
Same as above for subtracting 1: remove redundant outer parentheses.
Parentheses around the simple subtraction used as a function argument are redundant; the argument expression can be written as iter - 2.

Same as above for the third num_blocks call.

Parentheses around this variable used as a function argument are unnecessary; passing the identifier directly is clearer.

20 is already an int constant; an explicit cast to int is redundant.
Parentheses around this argument are unnecessary and can be removed to improve readability.
